alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 1:19AM CST until February 06 at 7:55PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Heavy rainfall in the past 24 hours is leading to rises on the Catoma Creek and a flood warning is now in effect. Another statement will be issued by this afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...From early this morning to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. At 24.0 feet, Residential and street flooding becomes a problem... and increases rapidly above 24 feet. Several residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 23.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
